channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Opinion: Remembering Catherine O'Hara
item.description: Actor Catherine O'Hara, famed for her comedic skill, died Friday at her home in Los Angeles following a brief illness. She was 71.
item.content:encoded:
Actor Catherine O'Hara, famed for her comedic skill, died Friday at her home in Los Angeles following a brief illness. She was 71.

(Image credit: John Phillips/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The U.S. will likely lose its measles elimination status. Here's what that means
item.description: The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.
item.content:encoded:
The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.

(Image credit: Annie Rice)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 23 Palestinians as Gaza ceasefire inches forward
item.description: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting.
item.content:encoded:
Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With decades-long restrictions lifted, a Pakistani brewery has started exporting beer
item.description: Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's being exported to the U.K., Japan and Portugal. Is the U.S. next?
item.content:encoded:
Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's being exported to the U.K., Japan and Portugal. Is the U.S. next?

(Image credit: Betsy Joles for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Want to get stronger? Start with these 6 muscle-building exercises
item.description: If you're curious about starting a resistance training routine and not sure to begin, start with these expert-recommended movements.
item.content:encoded: If you're curious about starting a resistance training routine and not sure to begin, start with these expert-recommended movements.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: A red hat, inspired by a symbol of resistance to Nazi occupation, gains traction in Minnesota
item.description: A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pattern sales will support the local immigrant community.
item.content:encoded:
A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pattern sales will support the local immigrant community.

(Image credit: Gilah Mashaal)
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: Venezuela announces amnesty bill that could lead to release of political prisoners
item.description: Venezuela's acting President Delcy Rodríguez on Friday announced an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of hundreds of prisoners detained for political reasons.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's acting President Delcy Rodríguez on Friday announced an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of hundreds of prisoners detained for political reasons.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: DHS keeps making false claims about people. It's part of a broader pattern
item.description: Trump administration officials have falsely linked Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good to domestic terrorism. It's part of a larger pattern by the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded:
Trump administration officials have falsely linked Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good to domestic terrorism. It's part of a larger pattern by the Department of Homeland Security.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: What to know about the partial government shutdown
item.description: The Senate passed a measure to avert a shutdown on Friday. But with the House on recess, funding for broad stretches of the federal government has technically lapsed.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate passed a measure to avert a shutdown on Friday. But with the House on recess, funding for broad stretches of the federal government has technically lapsed.

(Image credit: Rahmat Gul)
item.dc:creator: Lexie Schapitl

item.title: 'Melania' is Amazon's airbrushed and astronomically pricey portrait of the First Lady
item.description: Amazon paid $40 million to acquire the documentary, and is spending $35 million more to promote it.
item.content:encoded:
Amazon paid $40 million to acquire the documentary, and is spending $35 million more to promote it.

(Image credit: Muse Films)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello
